action.action-desc: Mrs. Brooks of Indiana (for herself and Mr. Sarbanes) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To extend and expand the Medicaid emergency psychiatric demonstration project.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Access to Emergency Psychiatric Care Act.

section.header: Extension and expansion of medicaid emergency psychiatric demonstration project

subsection.text: Subsection (d) of section 2707 of Public Law 111–148 (42 U.S.C. 1396a note) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3), the demonstration project established under this section shall be conducted for a period of 3 consecutive years.

paragraph.header: Temporary extension of participation eligibility for selected States

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B) and paragraph (4), a State selected as an eligible State to participate in the demonstration project on or prior to March 13, 2012, shall, upon the request of the State, be permitted to continue to participate in the demonstration project through September 30, 2016, if—

clause.text: the Secretary determines that the continued participation of the State in the demonstration project is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act; and

the Chief Actuary of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services certifies that such extension for that State is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall provide each State selected to participate in the demonstration project on or prior to March 13, 2012, with notice of the determination and certification made under subparagraph (A) for the State.

paragraph.header: Extension and expansion of demonstration project

subparagraph.text: Taking into account the recommendations submitted to Congress under subsection (f)(3), the Secretary may permit an eligible State participating in the demonstration project as of the date such recommendations are submitted to continue to participate in the project through December 31, 2019, if, with respect to the State—

clause.text: the Secretary determines that the continued participation of the State in the demonstration project is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act; and

the Chief Actuary of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services certifies that the continued participation of the State in the demonstration project is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

subparagraph.header: Option for expansion to additional States
subparagraph.text: Taking into account the recommendations submitted to Congress pursuant to subsection (f)(3), the Secretary may expand the number of eligible States participating in the demonstration project through December 31, 2019, if, with respect to any new eligible State—

clause.text: the Secretary determines that the participation of the State in the demonstration project is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act; and

the Chief Actuary of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services certifies that the participation of the State in the demonstration project is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall provide each State participating in the demonstration project as of the date the Secretary submits recommendations to Congress under subsection (f)(3), and any additional State that applies to be added to the demonstration project, with notice of the determination and certification made for the State under subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and the standards used to make such determination and certification—

clause.text: in the case of a State participating in the demonstration project as of the date the Secretary submits recommendations to Congress under subsection (f)(3), not later than August 31, 2016; and
in the case of an additional State that applies to be added to the demonstration project, prior to the State making a final election to participate in the project.

paragraph.text: The Secretary annually shall review each participating State’s demonstration project expenditures to ensure compliance with the requirements of paragraphs (2)(A)(i), (2)(A)(ii), (3)(A)(i), (3)(A)(ii), (3)(B)(i), and (3)(B)(ii) (as applicable). If the Secretary determines with respect to a State's participation in the demonstration project that the State's net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act has increased as a result of the State's participation in the project, the Secretary shall treat the demonstration project excess expenditures of the State as an overpayment under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

subsection.text: Subsection (e) of section 2707 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking Limitations on Federal;

subparagraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking 5-year; and
by striking through December 31, 2015 and inserting until expended;

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively;
in paragraph (3) (as so redesignated), by striking and the availability of funds and inserting (other than States deemed to be eligible States through the application of subsection (c)(4)); and

clause.text: by inserting (other than a State deemed to be an eligible State through the application of subsection (c)(4)) after eligible State; and
by striking paragraph (4) and inserting paragraph (3); and

subparagraph.text: by inserting after the first sentence the following: In addition to any payments made to an eligible State under the preceding sentence, the Secretary shall, during any period in effect under paragraph (2) or (3) of subsection (d), or during any period in which a law described in subsection (f)(4)(C) is in effect, pay each eligible State (including any State deemed to be an eligible State through the application of subsection (c)(4)), an amount each quarter equal to the Federal medical assistance percentage of expenditures in the quarter during such period for medical assistance described in subsection (a). Payments made to a State for emergency psychiatric demonstration services under this section during the extension period shall be treated as medical assistance under the State plan for purposes of section 1903(a)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396b(a)(1))..

subsection.text: Subsection (f) of section 2707 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a note) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Recommendation to congress regarding extension and expansion of project
paragraph.text: Not later than September 30, 2016, the Secretary shall submit to Congress and make available to the public recommendations based on an evaluation of the demonstration project, including the use of appropriate quality measures, regarding—

subparagraph.text: whether the demonstration project should be continued after September 30, 2016; and
whether the demonstration project should be expanded to additional States.

paragraph.header: Recommendation to congress regarding permanent extension and nationwide expansion

subparagraph.text: Not later than April 1, 2019, the Secretary shall submit to Congress and make available to the public recommendations based on an evaluation of the demonstration project, including the use of appropriate quality measures, regarding—

clause.text: whether the demonstration project should be permanently continued after December 31, 2019, in 1 or more States; and
whether the demonstration project should be expanded (including on a nationwide basis).

subparagraph.text: Any recommendation submitted under subparagraph (A) to permanently continue the project in a State, or to expand the project to 1 or more other States (including on a nationwide basis) shall include a certification from the Chief Actuary of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services that permanently continuing the project in a particular State, or expanding the project to a particular State (or all States) is projected not to increase net program spending under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

The Secretary shall not permanently continue the demonstration project in any State after December 31, 2019, or expand the demonstration project to any additional State after December 31, 2019, unless Congress enacts a law approving either or both such actions and the law includes provisions that—

clause.text: ensure that each State's participation in the project complies with budget neutrality requirements; and

require the Secretary to treat any expenditures of a State participating in the demonstration project that are excess of the expenditures projected under the budget neutrality standard for the State as an overpayment under title XIX of the Social Security Act.

paragraph.text: Out of any funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, there is appropriated to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services Program Management Account to carry out this subsection, $100,000 for fiscal year 2015, to remain available until expended.

subsection.text: Section 2707 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), in the matter before paragraph (1), by inserting publicly or after institution for mental diseases that is;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking An eligible State and inserting Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (4), an eligible State;
in paragraph (3), by striking A State shall and inserting Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (4), a State shall; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In the event that the Secretary makes a recommendation pursuant to subsection (f)(4) that the demonstration project be expanded on a national basis, any State that has submitted or submits an application pursuant to paragraph (2) shall be deemed to have been selected to be an eligible State to participate in the demonstration project.
in the heading for subsection (f), by striking and report and inserting , report, and recommendations.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
